result.execSummary:
The defendant Logan B Orr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs to be paid at $150.00 per month commencing 8/1/16 and each month thereafter or penalty of 14 days jail for non-payment.

Costs to be paid along with fine.

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Logan B Orr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Logan B Orr in court with attorney Tedia K. Gamino.  Edward M Bremberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for sentencing hearing. State presents statements. Defense presents statements. Court imposed the following sentence:

Fine $568
DNA Surcharge $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Defendant to pay $150/month or alternate of 14 days jail
Sentencing hearing on July 7, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on June 22, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Logan B Orr in court with attorney Katherine Jean Graber.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Natalie Schiferl, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1.  Count 2 is dismissed and read-in.  Defense counsel is requesting a separate sentencing date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 22, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
Jury status hearing at 04-28-2016 10:30 am
Jury trial - 12 person at 05-03-2016 08:30 am
Trial scheduling order

Defendant Logan B Orr in court with attorney Joseph Smith.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment for his client to finish counseling. Court puts the matter on the trial calendar.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for May 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for April 28, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-11-2016 01:45 pm

Defendant Logan B Orr in court with attorney Joseph Smith.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Smith requests an adjournment of the hearing today to allow time for Defendant to complete and provide proof of AODA treatment to the State per the pretrial offer/amendment.  The State does not object to the adjournment request.  Plea and sentencing scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
Status update filed by Attorney Smith.

Defendant Logan B Orr in court with attorney Joseph Smith.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant needs to complete assessment and attorney Smith is requesting adjournment. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Hearing at 10-12-2015 09:00 am

Attorney Joseph Smith in court.   Defendant Logan B Orr did not appear.   Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment. State has no objections. Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on September 28, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Logan B Orr in court with attorney Joseph Smith.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel request adjournment. Court grants.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on August 12, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Hearing on August 6, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney Joseph Smith in court.   Defendant Logan B Orr did not appear.   Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Attorney appears by authorization.  Hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Hearing on July 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant Logan B Orr in court.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.    Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
